episodeTitle: Miracle on Skypiea! The Love Song Heard in the Clouds!
description: The climactic battle between Luffy and Enel reaches its conclusion as Luffy uses the golden ball to destroy Enel's Raigo and defeats the self-proclaimed god, ringing the legendary Golden Bell and sending its beautiful sound across the sky to the Blue Sea below.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan Debut
events.description: Luffy uses the golden ball attached to his arm to perform a new variation of his Hanabi technique. By spinning his body around and colliding the golden ball with Enel's Raigo thundercloud, he uses it as an electrical conductor to destroy the storm cloud.
events.significance: This technique saves Skypiea from destruction by Enel's Raigo attack. It demonstrates Luffy's ability to turn Enel's own trap (the golden ball) into a weapon against him.

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses the golden ball as a conductor to destroy Enel's Raigo

events.title: Sky Clears Over Skypiea
events.description: Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Hanabi successfully clears the sky, causing the sun to shine through and dissipating Enel's destructive Raigo thundercloud. The villagers and Shandia watch in shock and hope as the storm that threatened to destroy their home disappears.
events.significance: This moment represents the literal clearing of darkness over Skypiea, both physically and metaphorically, as Enel's tyrannical reign comes to an end.

events.title: Enel's 200,000,000 Volt Amaru Transformation
events.description: Incensed at Luffy foiling his plans, Enel transforms into his ultimate state: 200,000,000 Volt Amaru. He grows into a huge, potbellied, Raijin-like lightning figure, morphing his body into pure electricity at maximum voltage. In this state, he can fire enormous electrical bolts and wield his gold staff as burning tridents.
events.significance: This represents the full extent of Enel's Goro Goro no Mi powers and his desperation to defeat Luffy. Despite this overwhelming transformation, it ultimately proves ineffective against Luffy's rubber body.

quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel declares his divinity as he transforms into his Amaru form

events.title: Luffy's Inner Thoughts Heard for First Time
events.description: For the first time in the entire One Piece series, Luffy's inner thoughts are heard. He briefly reflects on Conis' tears over the responsibilities forced on the citizens of Skypiea and Aisa tearfully asking if Sky Island was truly going to disappear.
events.significance: This is an extremely rare narrative moment in One Piece. Luffy almost never has his inner thoughts revealed, making this a unique instance that highlights the emotional weight of the situation and Luffy's empathy for the people of Skypiea.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle Defeats Enel
events.description: Luffy uses the golden ball and his twisted arm to deliver a devastating blow to Enel with a new technique: Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle (Golden Rifle). The attack is so fast that even Enel's Mantra (Observation Haki) cannot help him dodge it, despite detecting it. The massive sonic boom from the punch sends Enel crashing into the Golden Bell.
events.significance: This finishing move defeats the tyrannical god Enel and ends his reign over Skypiea. The technique's speed exceeds even lightning-fast reactions, demonstrating that Luffy has surpassed Enel in this crucial moment.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's finishing blow that defeats Enel

events.title: The Golden Bell Rings After 400 Years
events.description: As Luffy's punch sends Enel crashing into the Golden Bell, the legendary bell rings for the first time in 400 years. The beautiful sound echoes across the sky and can be heard all the way down in the Blue Sea, proving the existence of the City of Gold.
events.significance: This moment fulfills a 400-year-old promise and vindicates Mont Blanc Noland's legacy. The bell's ring symbolizes the end of the war between Skypieans and Shandia, the defeat of Enel, and the proof that the City of Gold exists in the sky.

events.title: Mont Blanc Cricket Hears the Golden Bell
events.description: Down in the Blue Sea, Mont Blanc Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance hear the sound of the Golden Bell of Shandora ringing. The beautiful sound, accompanied by a large shadow of Luffy cast on the clouds, proves that the City of Gold that Noland found was true and in the sky all along.
events.significance: This vindicates the 400-year legacy of Mont Blanc Noland, freeing Cricket from the burden of proving his ancestor was not a liar. Cricket bursts into tears of happiness at finally knowing the truth and learning that the Straw Hats are still alive.

events.title: Enel's Defeat
events.description: Enel is finally defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle, ending his tyrannical reign over Skypiea. Despite possessing one of the strongest Logia-type Devil Fruits and transforming into his ultimate 200,000,000 Volt Amaru form, Enel is unable to overcome Luffy's rubber body and determination.
events.significance: This marks the end of the main conflict in the Skypiea Arc. Enel's defeat liberates both the Skypieans and Shandia from his oppressive rule and allows peace to return to the sky islands.

quotes.text: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses the golden ball to destroy Enel's Raigo

quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: Enel transforms into his Amaru form

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's finishing blow that defeats Enel and rings the Golden Bell

themes.description: The episode fulfills a 400-year-old promise as the Golden Bell rings, vindicating Noland's legacy and proving Cricket's faith in his ancestor.
themes.symbolism: The Golden Bell represents the power of truth to endure across generations, no matter how long it's buried or forgotten.
culturalReferences: The story of Mont Blanc Noland and the liar's legacy

themes.description: Luffy defeats the tyrannical Enel, freeing the people of Skypiea and the Shandia from oppression and ending their 400-year conflict.
themes.symbolism: The clearing of the sky represents the end of darkness and the return of hope and peace.

themes.description: For the first time in the series, Luffy's inner thoughts reveal his empathy for Conis and Aisa, showing that his fight is motivated by genuine concern for others.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's rare internal monologue emphasizes the emotional weight of saving Skypiea.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his growth as a fighter and his empathy for others. His inner thoughts are heard for the first time, revealing the emotional motivation behind his actions.
keyActions: Destroys Enel's Raigo with Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan
Defeats Enel with Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle
Rings the Golden Bell, fulfilling Noland's 400-year-old promise
quotes: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan!

characterSpotlights.development: Enel unleashes his ultimate power in the form of 200,000,000 Volt Amaru but is ultimately defeated, ending his reign as the self-proclaimed god of Skypiea.
keyActions: Attempts to destroy Skypiea with Raigo
Is defeated by Luffy and knocked into the Golden Bell

characterSpotlights.development: Cricket finally hears the Golden Bell from the Blue Sea, vindicating his ancestor Noland and freeing him from the burden of proving the City of Gold's existence.
keyActions: Hears the Golden Bell ring from Jaya
Realizes the City of Gold is in the sky

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle scenes and adds more dramatic pauses to emphasize the emotional weight of Luffy ringing the Golden Bell.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first and one of only two times in the entire One Piece series where Luffy's inner thoughts are heard. The second occurrence is in Episode 279.
The episode received a TV rating of 11.0%, ranking at #5 for the week it aired in Japan.
The Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle attack was so fast that even Enel, who could move at the speed of lightning, could not react to it despite his Mantra detecting it.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapters 297-298 of the manga.
